Reviews.Title: “Clean and tidy”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Marinova
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband spent 4 nights there in the middle of February 2012. It is very clean and tidy hotel, near Termini station (20 minustes walk), good breakfast. The neighbouhood is not good - it seemed to be like China town there. But the greatest problem was the service - extremely unfriendly and unhelpful staf, even rude at a time! Such a dissapointment! Nevertheless, if one doesn't mind the service - the hotel is worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: helenamcd
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to Termini station. The rooms are clean and cute, but the bathroom is very small. Breakfast is satisfactory. Downside: it doesn't have wi-fi, there is only one computer available. At the moment on check-in is informed that you are charged 2 euros per day: fee for tourists.The attendants are a rude. In general, the hotel is very good, I recommend the hotel because of location and price.

Reviews.Title: “value for money!”
Reviews.Author: efou
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend spent 5 nights in this hotel. It was really worth the money we payed for it. First of all, it's location is good since it's close to the metro station "Manzoni" (7 minutes walk) and also rather close to the "Termini" train and metro station (15-20 minutes walk). The rooms were cute and clean but a little small. The bathroom was rather new and clean. There was adequate heating of the room and a nice TV. Unfortunately no balconies just windows, but we visited during winter so it didn't really matter! The breakfast was satisfactory, not something special but fine (cereals, yogurt, bread, cheese, ham, honey, marmalade, coffee, tea, milk- I think they should have some fruit and vegetable). There was a bit of noise since our room was at the side of a rather busy street, but not something very annoying. The only problem I would point out is that there was not a double bed as we had asked but two single beds put one next to the other. In general I would recommend this hotel as value for money and for its rather good location.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied about Hotel Parker”
Reviews.Author: GabbeDutch
Reviews.Content: In former reviews I read about rude staff members in this hotel. Well, may be they are not working in Hotel Parker anymore, because we only met friendly and helpful staff during our 3-night stay. The room was spacious and clean, so was the bathroom. Towels where changed every day. Breakfast was served in the basement that had daylight. There was a lot of bread, cheese, meat, jams, yogurt and cereals and of course coffee machines for all kind of different coffee. Getting there was very easy. We took the Leonardo express from Fiumicino airport to Termini Station, but the train ends at Roma Lazialli station. To get to Termini station you have to walk about 300 meter, but the best is to leave Lazialli station on the Via Giovanni Giolotti side and then take the tram that is in front of the station. Get out at the first stop en walk about 200 meter. Traveling into the old town, we walked ca. 230 meter to Piazza di Porta Maggiore. There we could find a lot of buses and trams to all kind of different destinations. The only minor was the absence of WiFi for the guests. I think that every hotel or Bed&Breakfast have to have this service nowadays. But overall, we had a nice stay in this good budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “bad location”
Reviews.Author: hadarami
Reviews.Content: we spent 4 nights in this hotel. the first 2 on the first floor, which was very noisy (wallpaper thin walls and noisy plumbing, plus you can hear the trains coming and going to termini station). location: close to termini station, you can use the metro to go everywhere - which is a plus. the downsides are the noise, the scarry invoirment after dark that unabells enjoying a walk aroung night time. breakfast: pastries, bread, cheese and ham. no vegetebels or fruit. on our 4th day the juice machine went dead and the staff failed to provide drinks that day. the hotel is very clean. bottom line: the rooms are very small. it is nowhere close to a 15 min. walk to the colosseum like said in other reviwes. i advise choosing a hotel in a better enviorment.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, convenient for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Tony C
Reviews.Content: First impressions were not good as we were met on our arrival by an unsmiling, unfriendly, unhelpful receptionist. This same person was on duty another evening during our stay when we enquired about the air conditioning, she was most unhelpful, yet the young gentleman on duty later that night was friendly and courteous and resolved our problem. Fortunately, the majority of the hotel staff were helpful and courteous and had good english. The room was small but adequate and the ensuite bathroom was very good. The room was serviced every day and the towels were changed each day also. The breakfast was quite good and there was always enough food available. When you exit the Termini the hotel is at the opposite end of Via Giolitti, about 15 minutes walk. There is also a tram line in front of the hotel and the trams start running quite early in the morning. They can be a bit noisy if you're a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneAlex
Reviews.Content: Maybe it was just the bathroom (much bigger after the tiny one in Paris) but I loved this hotel. The staff are generally very nice. We woke one guy up at 4am and he was still very nice. It can be a bit of a problem explaining something complicated, but language is generally not a problem. Rooms are clean and very nice. Plenty big enough, though perhaps that was just us. Some might find them small but they are very comfortable. Location is good. It might seem like torture walking from Termini to the Hotel especially after a long day. I wouldn't recommend doing it with a suitcase. But its reasonable. There are some great restaurants nearby. Tours pick up from this hotel, which is a bonus. Overall, its a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Tom H
Reviews.Content: A good value hotel, with good access to the underground (though Rome's underground is often maligned!), reasonable breakfast, and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Good sleep, good location”
Reviews.Author: is6826a
Reviews.Content: I went with my mom and we had a room with a bathroom... it was clean, front desk was friendly and helpful... location is good because you are near Termini and some buses that make it easy to move around, but the streets between the hotel and Termini might come out as scary... nothing ever happened to us, but I definitely speed up my walking.. I think it was a good option for our budget...

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but worth the stay!”
Reviews.Author: EdTaylor1986
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend had a week here. On arrival it was very easy to check in, staff was very polite and helpful. The room was very basic but for the amount didn't expect much. Bathroom was a little dirty. Mainly black marks around the edges of the shower cubicle ect. Breakfast is too basic. Some sort of hot cooked option would bring it up to standard. Very good stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Looking”
Reviews.Author: TRG12
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not offer much. Hostel like rooms (although you do get your own bathroom), no views, mediocre location, weak breakfast, no WIFI and a bizarre policy for the one computer they do have. For two euros you may use the internet until someone else comes along and asks to use it, however long or short that time period may be. Every other hotel in Italy we stayed at during our three week trip offered free WIFI. The ladies at the front desk during the day are polite, if not overly helpful. The gentleman at night is unpleasant. Despite our printed reservation stating that all taxes were paid. Hotel Parker insisted that we had to pay additional taxes at checkout. Keep looking, there are plenty of other hotels in this price range to try. This hotel was mediocre at best.

Reviews.Title: “Not good, not bad - just ok.”
Reviews.Author: Kallaliina
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we didn't get a smile, let alone a "hello", just a cheap look. Luckily another woman came in and did the check-in for us and she was friendly. After a few days this rude woman had a better attitude when we saw her again. Our room was cleaned every day and the whole hotel was a very clean place. We had to pay 2 euros per night for a tourist tax. This was told us when we leaving. Brekfast wasn't anything amazing, but it was ok. Our safety deposit box didn't work and we asked for someone to fix it, but nobody ever came. Taxi to the airport cost 60 euros for the five of us. There's an 10 minute walk to the termini station and a 15 minute walk to the Colosseum. A five minute walk to a fantastic restaurant called Il Tempio di Minerva.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, Rude and Ruder.”
Reviews.Author: Unhappy029
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel Parker after a nine hour journey to be greeted by a dour, unsmiling, off-hand ( to the point of utter rudeness) sour faced woman. She spoke to us in a manner that took our breath away! She informed us in no uncertain terms and in clipped tones that we had to pay a tax for being a tourist of 2 euros per person per day. She said the word "tourist" like it was a dirty word. There was no welcome at all. This woman at the Parker Hotel was not unusual. The girl that prepared the breakfast was rude and spoke with what can only be described as hatred in her voice. Later we met another just as rude and just as sour dark haired woman on the desk. These three women were an utter disgrace. They should remember that they are ambassadors to Rome, Italy and as such should act with more decorum and grace or else they should leave their present occupation. The maids that cleaned our room each day were courteous and helpful and very pleasant. These three unpleasant women should remember that if it wasn't for the tourists they wouldn't even have a job! My husband and I will NOT be returning or recommending anybody to this Hotel. Only book it if you like being spoken to like a piece of **it!

Reviews.Title: “NO need for a travel alarm”
Reviews.Author: amiunluckey
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel for you if you need an early start to the morning.From 06-30 every morning to late at night the local street tram passes the front of the hotel, we stayed on the first floor in the room at the front ,directly above the tram line.Noise,vibrations there is no chance off sleep. 15 min walk to main train station, Reception open 24 hrs,cleaner in room every day.safe in room, apart from noise o/k place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Realy bad hotel!”
Reviews.Author: IsabellaMartina
Reviews.Content: I arrived @ hotel parker due to a mix up with the hotel I booked. The man at the desk was nice and gave us the key. The room was big and clean. The airco wasn't working. While going to sleep, every 5 minutes a train passed. The only time there wasn;t a train passing was between 23:30 hour and 5:30 hour. Next moring went to the desk, the lady told me that it was bad luck. All hotels in Rome were not still and she could not do anything about it. I decided to transfer to a nother hotel and it was the best desicion I made in the whole holiday. SO DO NOT MAKE A RESERVATION AT HOTEL PARKER.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: KittensoftDublin
Reviews.Content: Because of the price I was really not expecting anything much. But this hotel had nice sized rooms with good air conditioning. It was 10-15 minute walk from Termini train station. The rooms were very clean and modern looking with a nice sized bathroom. Do not judge this hotel from the outside! Everything we needed for a city break. On the downside, the staff were not in the least bit friendly! One tip is to know that the Manzoni metro stop is very close by. You can walk to places but when your feet get sore it is good to know this!

Reviews.Title: “Say no to Hotel Parker”
Reviews.Author: audio255106
Reviews.Content: We are two friendly Kiwis and you need to know that all staff at Hotel Parker are rude and intimidating. This hotel should not be a service provider, WHATEVER YOU DO, DO NOT STAY HERE We stayed for 5 nights only becuase we had pre paid the accommodation, big mistake On arrival after a 13 hour flight we went to check in and were told that our room was not ready (we had pre booked our room from the previous day so it would be available) we politely pointed this out to the 2 surly women on reception. Both spoke good english but chose not to comment, they ignored us for 5 minutes then finally handed us a hotel card with our room number and underlined the breakfast times and check out time Next day we went to head to breakfast and asked reception which way? the women snarled back at us, "down stairs". Because we were booked on excursions we had to confirm daily with the tour operator through reception, because of there attitude we would draw straws to choose who had to go and confront reception to ask if they would please ring and confirm our booking, each time this was met with a sigh, they were all so rude and horrible to us Why did we stay? unfortunatly we had prepaid before we started our trip What would we do differently? we would contact our travel agent on the first day and say "get us out of here" What we learnt? always check hotel reviews and go to places recommeded by others Hopefully by adding our reviews we had not stayed at Hotel Parker in vien This place should not be in business

Reviews.Title: “This is a must try hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bonde8900
Reviews.Content: Very serviceminded and friendly staff. No doubt that next time I take a journey to Rome this will be the place I will stay again. So if you haven´t booked your hotel yet I recommend that you choose Hotel Parker.

Reviews.Title: “Location - close to station and neat with good service”
Reviews.Author: RiaanSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: Hotel very clean and within walking distance of all transport. Very good service and clean and large rooms. Riaan Du Plessis. Bethlehem. South Africa.

Reviews.Title: “Cant be a 3 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EuropeLover88
Reviews.Content: Me and my spouse stayed there for 5 nights. First of all, location. Location is not very good, about 10-15 mins walk from Metro station. Secondly, staff are ridiculous. Not friendly, rude and slow. At the time I checked in, the staff told me he need to keep my passport for 1-2 hours to do the paperwork. Then I told him, nope, I aint gonna leave it with you for such a long time, he was quite pissed then and did the paper work in less than 5 mins. What an attitude! Damn.. Then in our room. Hair dryer wasnt working.. Asking for a portable and they dont even have anything spare. Overall our stay there can be describe in 5 characters "SUCKS"

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel, but a little far from the city centre. Still: Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bjuux
Reviews.Content: Hi, Me and my friend stayed for four nights at this hotel, from 24 until 28 August. We had a great stay, although the staff wasn't very nice. I must say, the Italians in Rome were worse, so it wasn't that bad after all. Unfortunately we hadn't all the blankets we needed, and we weren't helped immediately. She "had to think about it", to give us another.. we found that pretty weird, but the next day we had all the blankets we needed. The room was perfect; we stayed on the 4th floor in a twin room. Airconditioning, a fridge, a tv, clean towels every day, clean bedspreads and blankets every day, great beds and the bathroom was decent. The shower was super! We also really enjoyed the breakfast; sweet croissants, normal rolls, plenty of sandwich filling, orange juice, tea, coffee, hot chocolate, yoghurt, etc. It was maybe a bit common, but for a cheap hotel it was really decent. The only thing was the reachableness of the centre of Rome. We could easily walk to the Termini Station or the Colosseum, but further asked for much time. We were glad that there was a metro station in the neighborhood; Manzoni. Over all, it's a good location. It's a cheap hotel with great rooms and a decent breakfast, and it's very clean. They've got wonderful housekeeping, every day! My compliments! There was also no curfew and the elevator made going upstairs easy. I strongly recommend this hotel, so if there's a good offer: Take it! Regards, Bouke

Reviews.Title: “For what it's worth...”
Reviews.Author: Megan_84Melbourne
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews for the Hotel Parker, i was relatively sure that the hotel would be sufficient for a 3 star hotel. To say the least, i was disappointed. First of all, the hotel is located approx 20 minutes walk from Termini station, not 10 minutes. There was no point in calling a taxi to pick us up from the hotel to the train station. To us, being close to public transport was important. The area in general was quite appalling, there was graffiti and a lot of rubbish around near the hotel. I actually felt scared walking to the hotel from the shops at times. House keeping wasn't completed by 1pm. We went out for the morning to come back to our beds still un made. To my understanding there was only one girl who did all of the rooms. This hotel has 4 levels and about 5 rooms per level. When they were cleaned, it was ok. The staff arent that helpful, there was one in particular. I'm sure it was the communication barrier but her overall attitude was not helpful or pleasent. She could not even help me when my wallet was stolen. She couldnt even tell me if there are any decent shops around the area. Couldnt even begin to help me with my phone card or telling me where i could have access to internet. Having been my first trip to Rome, i felt disorientated even having stayed at a hotel in the city - lucky i organised some tours. If you are comfortable with walking a long distance to Termini station, having to travel out of your way to see things, then this should be ok as this "hotel" is not close to anything in particular in terms of monuments or attractions. I dont want people to think this is a 'hotel' because it definately didnt feel like it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, basic, friendly and very reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: havetofly
Reviews.Content: 3 star hotel, ten minutes walk from the Termini, basic hotel but it was perfectly clean, the beds were a little hard altough i would have slept on a log after all the walking. It was very reasonably priced and we slept, showered and had breakfast there and were gone from morning to night so it was perfect for this. I would reccommend it for its cleanliness, the beds were made every day and we got new towels. The breakfast was the usual rolls, croissants, salamis and cheese and toast and you could have as much as you wanted. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. The area was very poor, being near the station there was a few homeless people late at night but we never had any trouble. It was handy to be near the station to get the metro, bus to airport etc. If i went again I would stay near the Trevi fountain/Spanish steps.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, slightly out of way for attractions”
Reviews.Author: mrsmojito
Reviews.Content: stayed at the hotel parker for 2 nights in nov 2008. the hotel is approx 10 mins walk from termini station which is very handy for the coach drop off/pick up from the airport. the hotel was clean and rooms were reasonably spacious. the tram line was directly outside our room and was quite noisy although this stopped at around eleven. breakfast in the hotel was average. the main drawback of the hotel is it's about 10 min walk from nearest metro station and there's very little nightlife in the direct vicinity. there was a restaurant 2 mins round the corner which reception recommended and this was very good and very reasonably priced. overall hotel was reasonable for what we paid, but we would probably try and stay somewhere more central in future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Budget Hotel In Rome!”
Reviews.Author: tashandbradworldwide
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel and were pleasantly surprised at how close it is to Termini Station. Within 5 minutes walk down Via Giovanni Golitti, away from the hustle and bustle of the city. We checked in and found our room upstairs and were surprised at how big and bright our room was. Tiled floors and a large bed with a nice view over the surrounding suburbs. Clean bathroom with a pretty decent shower topped off the room. Breakfast the next morning was a pretty standard but nice version of the continental breakfasts you get pretty much everywhere in Europe. Croissants, toasts, meats, jams and coffee; all pretty much standards. If you're looking for somewhere that is clean, safe and relatively inexpensive for Rome, with easy access to the best ways to travel to other parts of Italy, this place is perfect. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A Neat Well Connected Small Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: B_TravellerSingapore
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed with my family for 4 days at Hotel Parker. The overall stay was very comfortable and cosy. The room had three beds in a 2 bedroom sized room, with a small safe, cupboards, fridge, lamps and two tables. The size was good for 2 beds but 3 were a bit cramped up. The room was cleaned everyday and was very neatly kept. The toilet was especially very clean and tilled with the towels changed everyday. The breakfast was especially good and the staff was quite helpful. They helped us with the various bus routes, etc. during our stay and made our stay memorable. Transportation wise, the hotel was centrally located and so there was no issue in finding an appropriate tram or bus or a metro, all three being within 5-10 minutes walking distance from the hotel. From a B&B perspective, this was an overall excellent hotel, though we felt that Euros 155 per night of stay was a bit on the expensive side.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and a bit romantic”
Reviews.Author: CicciS
Reviews.Content: We had a really good weekend at this hotel. Good location near metro, quite big rooms, clean and a really good breakfast. Priceworthy!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel for short trip”
Reviews.Author: Longtom
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights here in January 2008 and found to be a great value for money hotel. Room was very clean and was cleaned out each day we were there and bathroom completely cleaned also.Towels were changed every day and bed remade also. We paid £141 for four nights and would think that would be very difficult to beat anywhere for 2 people B&B. It is well located for geting around the sights in Rome and only a ten minute walk to the Termini Station. I've been twice now and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it. Staff always very polite and pleasant we found.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for those on a smaller budget!”
Reviews.Author: J020
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Parker for a week and found it catered for all of our needs. The rooms were cleaned everyday and unlike other travellers reviews we had full control of the air conditioning in our room. The hotel is in a good location with many places to eat in the surrounding area, although some may find the walk to some of the main tourist attractions a little long. The only fault we could find is that some members of the staff can come across as being rude, possibly due to the limited understanding of English. Overall, we feel this hotel is ideal for those on a smaller budget and although small, offered everything we needed for a great week in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “gain”
Reviews.Author: pooroldpom
Reviews.Content: arrived midday to find no help from staff. building work all around hotel including outside our room.half of stair cases had carpet removed making stairs dangerous.no air conditioning or facilites in room..was supposed to be triple share but was a small double with extra bed in ..no room to move .robe was unstable and unusable .shower area was dangerous and ill equiped shower head hanging off.floors slippery and dangerous.we being the older generation would expected more.no phone available..graffetee everyware streets outside filthy and rubbish and muck everywere lift in hotel was intermitant with use. discusting never again will i think of rome as a pleasant city.

Reviews.Title: “nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucinda85
Reviews.Content: got back from rome last sunday, we stayed at the parker hotel, took us about 20 mins to walk from the termini train station, theres grafitti everywhere u go in this part of rome. staff are friendly, rooms cleaned everyday, nice but basic, sky tv but only 1 channel CNN. Rome is amazing, and this is a good location because termini is the main station and you can go everywhere without having to get off and change trains or tram.

Reviews.Title: “I won't never ever again go in this hotel Parker”
Reviews.Author: TrAveLLer_3_3_3g
Reviews.Content: When we made a booking, main thing was that the hotel has AIR CONDITIONING and Hotel Parker was supposed to have it (I assume that air conditioning means that it is available 24/7). Well, first night was quite okay, but after that air conditioning was working few hours at the time. Complaining didn´t help at all...I don´t know if they wanted to save some money, but it was staffs decision every time to turn off the air conditioning. For me it is the same thing as breaking our deal, I am expecting to have what is promised. At least hotel should state on their web site that customer will have AC only once and a while. Also minibar was totally missing from the rooms. For me as a frequent traveller this was the worst hotel I have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sauna”
Reviews.Author: Jill1408
Reviews.Content: This hotel is shocking, the rooms are acceptable but very hot, the air conditioning is a complete disaster and after numerous phone calls to reception it came on for approx 10 mins, I was told to air con the whole hotel it woud blow the electrics, this is not good enough when the day time temperature was 38 degrees, no sleep for 2 nights after walking the length and breath of Rome was a killer. The station was a very long walk over very uneven pavements (do not attempt heels ladies). The breakfast was OK but not great. I would not stay here again, I did however get a £50 refund off the hotel booking agent, still no compensation for my partners birthday treat being ruined!!

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean Hotel Pleasant to look at Nearby for the Termini railway Station Good Breakfast Little things that let it down or could be explained better in the hotel ad on the internet site Cigarette burns in the bed spread - several A little overpriced I thought Double room consisted of 2 single beds pushed together Shower very small No tea/coffee facilities in the room No mini bar as advertised Staff not very friendly never seen them smile, welcome us or even say goodbye when we left No welcome pack, had to ask for tourist maps information etc No sound proofing between rooms, you could hear next door going to the loo, shower, hairdryer, flushing the loo No tpwels as we would expect but cotton sheet like towels - glad I took my own No fresh milk at breakfast all UHT Air conditioning was controlled from reception, no individual controls in the room Italian TV channels only

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Parker.....not good enough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Parker is not bad value for money. My room was single with all the usual facilities. Very clean. Good breakfast offered. Unfortunately there were some unbelievable faults which were not given in any of the reviews I previously read. (Aug.2005) Outside the lift was a massive hole with a board covering it.... Each time my party came into the lift or exited, we always tripped. One of us was elderly....Not good enough... The area was very dodgy.... Pick pockets, red light area....and the walk from Termini station takes at least 15/25 minites. Road works all along the road. No buses... Not recommended late at night. Unpleasant area and a long way from the centre. The outside terrace looked more like a scrapyard....a mess. I was kept awake most nights by several young men sharing a room. Very noisy and went on until 4am every morning. When I complained I was told another noisy party was due the same night. I wouldn't stay there again....

Reviews.Title: “Room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: ptah
Reviews.Content: The hotel was undergoing renovations at the time of our stay. The rooms and en suite bathrooms were quite good, but there were no in room tea or coffee facilities and no room service despite this hotel having three stars. The staff, particularly in the breakfast room, were very surly. Cereal was provided for breakfast but there were no bowls and when we asked for one we were told we had to use a coffee cup or plastic drinks cup. The hotel is situated about 10-15 min walk from Termini station and is in within walking distance of most of Rome's attractions. Would we stay there again? No.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Parker
HotelInfo.Address: Via Giolitti, 431, 00185 Rome, Italy
